title: Ministry of Economic Development and Trade (Ukraine)
text:
The Ministry for Development of Economy and Trade () is the main authority in the system of <a href="Cabinet%20of%20Ministers%20of%20Ukraine">central government of Ukraine</a> responsible for formation and realization of state economic and social development policies (<a href="business%20economics">business economics</a>); regulation of consumer <a href="price%20policy">prices</a>; <a href="Industrial%20policy">industrial</a>, <a href="Investment%20policy">investment</a> and <a href="Trade%20policy">trade economic</a> policies; development of <a href="entrepreneurship">entrepreneurship</a>; technical regulation and security of <a href="consumer%20rights">consumer rights</a>; inter-agency coordination of economic and social cooperation of Ukraine with the <a href="European%20Union">European Union</a>. In 2019-2020 it also encompassed functions of the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Agrarian%20Policy%20and%20Food%20%28Ukraine%29">Ministry of Agrarian Policy and Food</a>. 
The ministry is based on the former Ministry of Economy, taking its origin from the <a href="DerzhPlan">Planning Commission of the Ukrainian SSR</a>. Over the years it included such former ministries as Ministry of Trade and Ministry of Foreign Economic Relations. Activities of the current ministry are coordinated by the <a href="Cabinet%20of%20Ministers%20of%20Ukraine">Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine</a>.
Structure.
The ministry consists of the central body of ministry headed by its leadership composed of a <a href="Minister%20%28government%29">minister</a>, first deputy and other deputies to assist the minister. Ministry elects several state administrations representatives to coordinate operations of the government companies.
Between September an mid-December 2020 the ministry was also responsible for Ukraine's <a href="agricultural%20policy">agricultural policy</a>. On 29 August 2019 the <a href="Honcharuk%20Government">Honcharuk Government</a> merged the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Agrarian%20Policy%20and%20Food%20%28Ukraine%29">Ministry of Agrarian Policy and Food</a> into the ministry. On 17 December 2020 the agricultural ministry was resurrected when <a href="Roman%20Leshchenko">Roman Leshchenko</a> was appointed as Minister of Agricultural Policy and Food of the <a href="Shmyhal%20Government">Shmyhal Government</a>.
List of Ministers.
Economy.
<a href="Yulia%20Svyrydenko">Yulia Svyrydenko</a> is since 4 November 2021 simultaneous <a href="First%20Vice%20Prime%20Minister%20of%20Ukraine">First Vice Prime Minister of Ukraine</a> and Minister of Economic Development.
